docTitle.titlePart:
Recent development of sulfide solid electrolytes and interfacial modification for

front.div:
a b s t r a c t
Recent development of inorganic sulfide solid electrolytes and all-solid-state rechargeable lithium bat-
teries with them is reviewed. Electrical conductivity, electrochemical stability and chemical stability
of these sulfide electrolytes are reported. Formation of favorable solid–solid contacts between elec-
trode and electrolyte is important in all-solid-state batteries. Useful techniques to achieving intimate
electrode–electrolyte interfaces are proposed. Application of sulfur positive electrode and lithium metal
negative electrode with large theoretical capacity to all-solid-state lithium batteries is demonstrated.
